fields.description:
It seems that when a repository is transferred from an individual user account to a team account, the permission is not set automatically for the transferred repository.

However, when a repository is transferred from one team account to another, the permission is set automatically after the transfer.
fields.summary: permission not set correctly when transferring a repository to a team

fields.description:
I forked from private repository of our team and set read access to a group in the team.\\
The "You're over your plan limit. Committers have read only access." message appears.\\
It's very noisy.
fields.summary: "Committers have read only access" warning shown when I only allow read only access.

fields.description: I would like to be able to have a tracking system that is independent of the project. For example, my projects are related to each other, but they are separate (db project and java project). I will end up with 2 issue tracking systems, one for each projects. This is ok in the short term, but not good in the long term. I would like to have only one issue tracking system, with a project selection option (which are my two projects above). This way, I could see everything that is related to the overall project, and also reference tickets of cross-project issue. Sometimes I have an issue that is both Java and DB, and having one tacking systems will eliminate duplicates.
fields.summary: Issue Tracker Improvement (BB-5918)

fields.description: http://gyazo.com/183c3c18159e4c84b2df8983e7f1e28a
fields.summary: Modal window "Send an invitation" has broken link

fields.description: When you change an Issue's status in the API, it immediately adds an empty comment. As far as I can see there is no way to specify a comment when updating an Issue nor specify changed status when updating a comment.
fields.summary: Add comment when changing Issue status via API (BB-6188)

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to see the last updated date, and possibly the last updated/comment by user aside from the created date for a specific issue in the issue queue list for a given repository. I have been using the Bitbucket Team functionality to manage my open source and client projects and I feel this enhancement to the Issue Tracker will help manage older, and open issues more efficiently. I currently find myself having to open lingering issues and see when the last comment was, which is adding additional time to managing my issues.

Thanks!

Jason
fields.summary: Add updated date to issue queue list table.

fields.description:
== What I did:  ==\\
GET https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/privileges/lindenlab

== What I expected ==\\
json response with all existing repositories that had individual access rights configured.

== What I got ==\\
The returned list had all the repositories I expected, but also has entries for repositories that have been deleted (for example lindenlab/snowglobe)
fields.summary: REST API privileges endpoint returns deleted repositories (BB-5697)

Also, the repo was private, but I could see it being created on a different computer and not signed in. It showed my username and all details about the repo despite not being logged in and it being a private repo.

Hope this helped :)

fields.description: There should be a way to import issues from csv or similar into the Bitbucket issue tracker as well as a way to export the same.
fields.summary: Issue import and export (BB-5919)

fields.description: The repository user is NOT set to be notified of all new issues (Admin --> Notifications), they are NOT the issue owner/submitter, they are NOT assigned to the issue, and they are NOT watching the issue, yet they still get emailed.  This is basically spam for the project participants.  Please respect these settings for determining who to notify of new issues.
fields.summary: All repository users get notified for ALL new issues, regardless of settings

fields.description:
Just a funny typo in the /user/<user>/ssh-keys/ in the key paste box.

Should say "Paste your key here"

Not a very important bug but it's there.
fields.summary: Paste your key HRRRREEE
Wiki trying to render date as a changeset within a heading (BB-5397)

fields.description:
Sorry but the Govt Dept (DVA) I am consulting to still uses IE 7. The BitBucket console does not present well and is hindering company take up.\\
Any chance of this being fixed?\\
Cheers\\
Rob Tibbett\\
Director\\
0409 244 310\\
www.modernweb.com.au
fields.summary: Screen formatting way out using IE 7

fields.description: Can you please clear up my activity log as it has totally irrelevant stuff, which I don't want shown on my profile page? Thanks
fields.summary: Irrelevant Activity on Profile

fields.description: Any chance that these attributes could be made writeable? I would mean that I could correctly import historical issues in to the issue tracker.
fields.summary: Ability to set (utc_)created_on and utc_last_updated when creating/updating an issue. (BB-5623)

fields.description: On Admin tab it's possible to add notification e-mails. But bitbucket send notifications only if this address is registered on Account tab of repository user. This doesn' work for arbitrary address.
fields.summary: Issue tracker notifications send only to team user addresses (BB-6325)

fields.description:
This command from the guide\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+a+bitbucket+Wiki

bq. hg clone http://bitbucket.org/sarahmaddox/sarahmaddox/wiki


yields this error:

bq. abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error
fields.summary: Cannot clone wiki via https

fields.description:
Clicking on the heading of the "Repositories" menu takes you to /repo/mine, but this page doesn't show as much content as the drop-down menu does.

The menu includes "recently viewed" and "recently updated" repositories, but /repo/mine shows only those repositories that belong to you.

This causes a usability issue on touchscreens, where it would be expected that tapping the menu heading would give access to the same information as hovering over it does.
fields.summary: /repo/mine should also show repositories belonging to my teams (BB-5398)

fields.description:
Hello,

Please help me when i  use\\
git clone https://cindia@bitbucket.org/cindia/bb101repo.git\\
this command it's giving error that git is not reconizable .Please explain me how to fix it.
fields.summary: command error

fields.description:
Hi, I  have been trying to clone git://gitorious.org/fg/fgdata.git (large repository) via "Repositories" / Import repository

However, bitbucket always times out (cloning at gitorious or github works however), sometimes a proper error report is sent (but usually not).

While the website says that repository size is not limited by default, there is obviously a hard limit due to cloning timeout, as can be seen here?

It would be great if you could scale the timeout according to the repository size, and simply renice the background process, so that large clones are handled properly, but at a lower priority (CPU/BANDWIDTH-wise).

thanks
fields.summary: cloning of large remote repositories fails due to timeout

fields.description:
When removing access from a repository/team for a specific user, or a group containing that user, the user will still be listed as a follower of that repository.

The user will _NOT_ have any access to the repository any longer, but will show up in the followers list.
fields.summary: Removing a group or user from a repository doesn't remove them from followers (BB-5358)

fields.description:
Hey,

I think it would be pretty nice to have the Size, Date Modified, and Commit Message feilds filled for folders in the source browser. It helps at first glance to see what the last commit was, and when.

-Tom
fields.summary: Fill size, date modified, and commit message fields on folders (BB-5357)

fields.description:
Hy.

First i want to thank u for the kind to share this extention. I was looking for something nice, no fency and here u are.

i have downloaded the extension and i published the module on my site.

It appears to have some layout conflict with my template.

I set 3 modules in top1,top2 and top3 position.

thanks for helping me out.

best regards,

Mirela
fields.summary: variable error

fields.description: I subscribe to several private repositories via RSS but after several hours, my RSS reader reports an error and then claims "You must have read access to access the RSS feed." I then navigate to the repository and acquire a new RSS link which then works for several hours and the process repeats.
fields.summary: RSS link reports "You must have read access to access the RSS feed." after several hours (BB-5356)

fields.description:
In the bitbucket docs on getting started, there seems to be a typo in the header here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Create+an+Account+and+a+Git+Repo#CreateanAccountandaGitRepo-Step2.CreateaGitrepositorysitory(repo)

It currently says "Step 2. Create a Gitrepositorysitory" when it should say "Step 2. Create a Git Repository"
fields.summary: Typo in section header for BitBucket docs

fields.description:
I'm using wiki and I want to edit on my local machine and then push it to bitbucket.\\
but now bitbucket's wiki only support git over https, doesn't support git over ssh?
fields.summary: can wiki support git over ssh

fields.description:
Recent activity\\
Alexander Chibrikin\\
granted alek13 admin access to Anonymous\\
an hour ago

mmm... i don`t remember what i do... - something with groups in my new team-account:\\
i create new group, than delete it.\\
and i typing some names (several times) to add into existen group, but not add anybody...\\
maybe something else.

after this manipulations, i have admin access to Anonymous ('none' account)
fields.summary: grant admin rights to 'none' account

fields.summary: Alerts of Payment functionality is not working.

fields.description: I am trying to reply a message in my inbox. The textfield  where I should write my message is really small: height 1 line, width 22 chars. Source code tells me it has no width and height attributes set. Can you make it bigger? ;)
fields.summary: "Reply to message" textfield is too small in inbox (BB-5320)
REST API: Admin member of team account Forbidden to see members of group (BB-5355)

fields.description:
When urls are generated in the issue tracker and commit logs (i.e. reference to a ticket number, change set, etc.) they point to a 404 url when accessed via a custom subdomain.

The url is incorrectly including the account name when accessed via the account's custom subdomain. (e.g. http://git.pickslide.ca/pickslide/fpigallery/changeset/e00cfbe8a6e4 instead of http://git.pickslide.ca/fpigallery/changeset/e00cfbe8a6e4 )
fields.summary: URLs in Issues are incorrect when accessing via custom subdomain

fields.description:
That's it. Some (or most) of developers don't care about who follow/unfollow projects they follow. Other ones don't want to see commits or issues in the feed and so on.

I'm suggesting the following options:

* show/hide some events by type globally: (un)following, issues (+comments), commits (+comments)
* show/hide events by type for particular repository/user.

Thanks in advance.

fields.description:
I had a project called clj-minecraft (imported from github location1) which is now renamed to clj-minecraft2 here: https://bitbucket.org/basicsensei/clj-minecraft2\\
Before renaming I had added 2 comments to commit https://bitbucket.org/basicsensei/clj-minecraft2/changeset/4f2b984ae6ba0cb62607d9e0865f59390027fbf2  (which was then in clj-minecraft project)

After all that (done renaming), i imported clj-minecraft (from github location2 -if it even matters), and then I pushed the last push again which caused the same commit id: https://bitbucket.org/basicsensei/clj-minecraft/changeset/4f2b984ae6ba0cb62607d9e0865f59390027fbf2

All well and good, except if you check the list of commits for clj-minecraft here: https://bitbucket.org/basicsensei/clj-minecraft it shows 2 comments on this commit(but if you step inside there are none), but there are (supposed to be) none, but only the clj-minecraft2 project should have them (and it does).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Comments count from old-renamed-project show on the new-project-who-took-its-place (BB-5314)

The ability to put comments for a specific line, or maybe to be able to use simply short links to point to line numbers in comments ? like BCLOUD-11 would go to line 11 (maybe this is already possible but I only tested long urls that go to line numbers like: https://bitbucket.org/basicsensei/clj-minecraft/changeset/4f2b984ae6ba0cb62607d9e0865f59390027fbf2#chg_project.clj_newline10 )\\
This is how github does it: https://github.com/MarkehMe/FactionsPlus/commit/39fb0f68fe85f9ef1f60b16b1da54df6a1acac12#L0L232

Thanks.
fields.summary: Line comments (like github has)

fields.description:
Currently, if a member of a team doesn't have Admin or Create Repo permissions, they aren't shown as "Members" of a team on the Team's main page. This is to ensure security between groups that may have members that other group's members shouldn't see.

There should be a way for Administrators to decide which members/groups can be shown as Members of the team rather than basing this on permissions that few team members may have.
fields.summary: Add option to show/hide team members (BB-5275)

fields.description:
See screenshots attached. The sequence of steps I followed are:

h1. Fork a team repo ('saon/cigar-hmi' --> 'jbcotton/cigar-hmi')
h1. Clone it to my local machine.
h1. Make local commits. Create an annotated git tag. Run "git push --tags".
h1. Go to https://bitbucket.org/jbcotton/cigar-hmi/changesets (Repository-->Commits)
I can't see all the commits, even thought is says showing 1-25 of 25.\\
[See 1st screenshot].

h1. Click on Dashboard.
I _can_ see everything I pushed going to that repo.\\
[See 2nd screenshot].

h1. Click on the 1st commit sha-1.
I _can_ see the commit details in the rpeo, and trace its parent sha1's\\
all the way up.\\
[See 3rd screenshot].

h1. Click on the "Compare" button.
I can't see any outgoing commits to create a pull-request with.\\
[See 4th screenshot].

This is repeatable.

* If I repeat these steps WITHOUT creating a tag in Step 4, it works fine but I don't have my tag.
* If I repeat these steps WITH creating the tag in Step 4, but do the push in two steps, things also seem to work fine:\\
$ git push\\
$ git push --tags
fields.summary: after "git push --tags", newly pushed commits don't show under "Repository-->Commits" and are unavailable as outgoing changes for a pull request

fields.description: I often find that I raise an issue to a team member, and then want to be notified when a ticket has been addressed and needs to be tested.  Unfortunately, there appears to be no way to do that in Bitbucket - they either mark it as resolved and then I have no idea which ones have been tested or not, or they simply post a comment which means I have to pick up on that.  Is there not some way of either adding a workflow for "ready for testing" or similar?
fields.summary: Customisable workflow

fields.description:
I wrote a backup tool for Bitbucket repositories (Bitbucket Backup...you're featuring it on your "Explore Bitbucket" page) and I'm using the Bitbucket API to get a list of a user's repositories to backup.

My app asks the users for their username and password, and authenticates with the Bitbucket API to get their private repositories as well.

The thing is, I can't tell whether I'm authenticated or not. If the user enters the wrong password, the API returns only the public repositories, but my app can't tell that the authentication failed and that the private repositories are missing in the result.

So my app silently backs up public repositories only, and is not able display an error message to the user :-/

--> I need a way to find out whether I'm authenticated or not.

In the past I was able to tell this, because the API returned only a subset of the repository information when making a non-authenticated request.\\
Some of the repositories' properties were only returned on authenticated requests, so I just checked one of these (//has_wiki//) and when it was missing, I displayed a "wrong password" message.

But this doesn't work anymore, apparently the API was changed because of this issue:\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3439/unauthenticated-repo-api-results-lack
fields.summary: API: find out whether I'm authenticated (BB-5268)

fields.description:
It would be useful if there was some way of making mercurial repositories non-publishing.  This simply amounts to including the following lines in the {{.hg/hgrc}} file.  Unfortunately, there seems to be no way to access this from the bitbucket web interface:

{code}
[phases]
publish = False
{code}

h1. Use Case
One might like to maintain a private repository for an online backup.  Pushing to this private repository should not alter the phase of *draft* change-sets so that later rebasing etc. can be performed.  (Pushing to a public repository, or a shared private repository, however, should change the phase to *public*.)

As second use case is code review: it is useful to push ones code to a fork, so that a code review can be performed on a pull request.  At the end of the code review, one often wants to clean up the changes (rebasing) before the code is pulled back into the main project.  It would be very useful to be able to mark the review fork as non-publishing so that the phases are maintained, guiding this later rebasing.

h1. Reference
This was briefly discussed on the mailing list, then ignored:

[https://groups.google.com/d/topic/bitbucket-users/XCC5jmYo5FU/discussion|https://groups.google.com/d/topic/bitbucket-users/XCC5jmYo5FU/discussion]
fields.summary: Provide a method for setting the phase of a repository to non-publishing. (BB-5267)

fields.description:
Greetings.\\
Don't know if this is a bug or I'm just missing some settings, but...\\
I'm a fairly new bitbucket user and also new to version control systems, so I've been toying around with the repositories and update clients. It seems that after some experiments I have somehow managed to delete repository in a way that it didn't completely deleted. Logs doesn't show it's gone (only updates are visible) and at the same time I can't open it, geting the "Repository has been deleted" message. Also I can't create a new repository with the same name. After pressing "Create" button nothing happens.\\
The repository was called "Utils" (the URL: https://bitbucket.org/uhfath/utils).\\
I hope I've described the issue in details. If anything, I'm ready to answer any related questions.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Something like a "stuck ghost" repository
